website_summaries.verdict: The classic-inspired Danner Light has plenty of good attributes but still fell short on a few things. Earning the highest praise is the excellent craftsmanship that’s evident in this hiker. Its traction, waterproofness, and comfort straight out of the box made it a dependable everyday boot.However, despite the generally favorable reviews it gained, this Danner product still needs improvement in the width department. Most complaints hover around the narrowness of the gear. This issue aside, Danner Light has the elements for meeting the on-trail demands of potential buyers.
pros: The good craftsmanship behind these Danner Light boots impressed hordes of owners
Several wearers reported about its versatility
Aside from wearing it during outdoor adventures, they also used it for casual and day-to-day activities
Numerous outdoor-loving individuals were enthralled by the dependable traction of the boot’s outsole
A couple of hikers took notice of the waterproof upper of this reintroduced classic model from Danner
Some hikers who were more than satisfied with the overall features of the boots decided to buy multiple pairs
To a handful of owners, the Danner Light boots were a worthy investment
A few individuals shared that the gear didn’t require any breaking in
A little number of wearers found the leather and nylon upper as a power combo in terms of durability
cons: The Danner Light boots were too narrow according to a couple of wearers
An expert reviewer warned potential buyers that it is a little heavy

website_summaries.verdict: The Danner TrailTrek Light proved to be a capable below-the-ankle hiker with its satisfying comfort and fit. That being said, it tends to trap heat and cause sweaty feet. Nevertheless, the positive traits of this hiking shoe make it a worthy piece of gear.
pros: This hiking shoe felt very comfortable to wear, as stated by the majority
A good number of Danner TrailTrek Light owners were pleased with the footwear’s snug fit
Several users appreciated how the shoe required little-to-no break-in time
A few said that these hikers provided adequate arch support
This shoe granted relentless water protection, according to some consumers
cons: The minority said that it could get a bit warm, causing the foot to sweat
A user was disappointed because of this low-cut hiking shoe’s hefty weight
A few buyers complained about the Danner TrailTrek Light’s toe box by saying it was too small

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect with my Foot Orthitics
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Danner Shoes and these fit just like a glove first time. Even better I was able to put my foot orthotics without removing anything and my heel stays down. I have never found a pair of shoes that keeps my heel in the shoe weather walking or running. I thought Danner made all their shoes in the USA but these were made in VietNam.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C. Sweeeney

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - light - not attractive
customer_reviews.text: These are good hiking shoes that are comfortable and not frankenshoes, they do everything that you want them to do functionally, but they get a 1 star knock for being not very attractive. My favorite hikers are Vasque, the fit is perfect, they hold up well and they are attractive, so that's what I am comparing them too.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs RockTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Trail Treck
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of the same shoe/footware.....all exactly the same. This particular one seems a bit larger that the others even though I ordered the same size as before. The shoe fits and I will wear it. You cannot go wrong with a Danner product. I have 4 different styles for hiking and hunting. All are incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond H.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as wide as expected.
customer_reviews.text: A bit less wide than i would expect from a wide sizing but they work for me though they are a bit snug. Have been putting 5 - 8 miles a day on them in slightly soggy conditions and they stay dry and haven't fallen apart after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rain_in_Winter

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with them
customer_reviews.text: These boots arrived exactly as I have come to expect from the Danner company. They are ready for a hike right out of the box. They are built sturdy but still very comfortable. I'm going to take them out on a 4.5 mile hike this afternoon. If anything negative happens with the boots, I'll update this post. Not a big deal but I'm not real fond of the laces. They feel like they will break sooner than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Ugly Boot and too small
customer_reviews.text: These were too narrow and tight and frankly too ugly. You might like the look but I didn't. There are much better designed hiking boots in this day and age. I don't recommend these and would never buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes but could offer more cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Like the shoes, but they are not light, was expecting a little more cushioning from the ground. We hike everyday, so having a shoe that is light and more cushioning would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Arijit Bose

customer_reviews.title: Should buy another pair, I like them so much!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and lightweight. Great traction on snowy surfaces. Keeps my feet dry in slushy wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Severini

customer_reviews.title: Now I think I'm just going to wear them for work a shoe like this is to good for the closet
customer_reviews.text: Got these shoes for hiking but whore them to work to break them in . Now I think I'm just going to wear them for work a shoe like this is to good for the closet
customer_reviews.author: James bishop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I’ve bought this product and I will buy it again when I need another pair .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer ajk

customer_reviews.title: Steel toe...not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look and how solid the shoe was. I used for work in retail. It would have been O K if not for the shoe rubbing on top of toe.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.  Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit. Will use for everyday and occasional hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Emil Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light but rugged
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s they work good. I use them for hiking to solar ground racks and on the roof of homes and businesses.
customer_reviews.author: huckleberry

customer_reviews.title: First pair of Danner's that I was not perfectly satisfied with. I have several pairs of Danner hunting ...
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Danner's that I was not perfectly satisfied with. I have several pairs of Danner hunting boots that I still love (one pair is 6 years old) so I don't feel as though it's a "brand" problem. These just run large for thirteens and that was even after putting in an after market insole.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. O'Gara

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: 2 months and lots of break-in but tongue still has pressure points and upper construction way too stiff and not flexible. Upper creases across toebox and pinches toes on right foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Danner Mens TrailTrek Light 3" Gray/Blue-M TrailTrek Light 3" Gray/Blue
product_meta.description: The trail trek light is a versatile hiking shoe, perfect for easy to moderate day hikes and everyday adventures. The Danner plyolite midsole is lightweight, durable and provides maximum rebound for daylong use. AND your feet will stay dry both on and off the trail with Danner dry waterproof protection.
feature_bullets: Streamline, athletic platform for comfort and responsiveness
